intro: Monnina hassleri, commonly known as the hairy monnina, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants like buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Monnina hassleri is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant once established.
